headline.main: 'Freedom From Fear' Called Vital To Help World End Crises in Food; END OF FEAR HELD VITAL IN FOOD PLAN

lead_paragraph: HOT SPRINGS, Va., May 31 -- Following yesterday's production report, which urged an expanding world economy to make effective the "freedom from want" clause of the Atlantic Charter, the consumption and distribution sections of the United Nations Conference on Food and Agriculture made their reports today, recommending that the forty-four participating governments take "action in concert" after the war to establish "freedom from fear" as a world policy.
abstract: United Nations Conf on Food and Agr: repts stress need for world freedom from fear of aggression in post-war reorganization; text
